title: Soy Sauce Eggs
instructions: Cook the eggs in the egg cooker until hard-boiled.
Let them cool slightly, then peel off the shells.
Put soy sauce and salt into a sandwich bag or food container. Mix gently.
Place the peeled eggs inside, seal, and refrigerate overnight.
Turn the eggs halfway through to marinate evenly.
Can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

title: Egg Pancake
instructions: Beat eggs in a bowl, add flour, water, and salt, mix into a smooth batter.
Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a frying pan (just enough to coat).
Pour in the batter, spread evenly.
Cook on medium heat until both sides are golden.
Serve plain, or add ham, lettuce, or cheese and roll up.

title: Avocado Sandwich
instructions: Toast or lightly fry the bread slices.
Mash the avocado and spread on one slice of bread.
Add a fried egg (or sliced boiled egg) on top.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Cover with the other slice of bread.

title: Peanut Butter Sandwich
instructions: Toast bread slices if desired.
Spread peanut butter evenly on one slice.
Add jam or honey if desired.
Cover with the other slice of bread.

title: Milk with Oatmeal
instructions: Heat milk in a pot or microwave.
Add oats and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add honey, fruits, or nuts if desired.
Serve hot.

title: Cheese Toast
instructions: Place bread slices on a baking tray.
Sprinkle grated cheese evenly on top.
Bake at 180°C / 350°F for 5-7 minutes until cheese melts and turns slightly golden.
Serve hot.

title: Bacon & Fried Egg
instructions: Heat a frying pan, add bacon, cook until crispy.
Push bacon aside, crack eggs into pan, fry until whites are set.
Serve with toast or rice.

title: Scrambled Eggs
ingredients: Optional: handful of spinach or 3-4 sliced mushrooms
instructions: Beat eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Heat pan, add oil or butter.
(Optional) Cook spinach or mushrooms briefly.
Pour in eggs, let sit a few seconds, then stir gently with spatula.
Keep stirring until soft curds form.
Remove from heat while still slightly soft (carryover heat will finish cooking).
Serve plain or with toast.

title: Ham/Chicken Breast & Cheese Sandwich
ingredients: 2 slices ham or 2-3 slices roasted chicken breast
instructions: Lightly toast the bread slices.
Spread mayonnaise or butter.
Layer cheese, ham (or chicken), and lettuce.
Add cucumber or tomato slices if desired.
Cover with second slice, cut in half, and serve.

title: Tuna Sandwich
instructions: Drain tuna, place in bowl, break apart with fork.
Mix with mayonnaise (or yogurt + lemon), onion, celery, pepper.
Toast bread lightly, spread mayo if desired.
Place lettuce, spread tuna mixture on top.
Cover with second slice, cut in half, serve.

title: Mom's Oven-Baked Ribs
instructions: Mix all dry rub ingredients: brown sugar, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, salt, cornmeal, baking powder.
Pat ribs dry, rub mixture evenly on both sides.
Wrap each rib half with 2 sheets foil, seal tightly.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Mix marinade: soy sauce, vinegar, water.
Open foil corner, pour in 4-5 tablespoons marinade, reseal.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake for 90 minutes until tender.
Open foil, brush with honey, broil 3-5 minutes until caramelized.

title: Crispy Potato Wedges
instructions: Toss wedges with 1/2 teaspoon salt, let sit 10 minutes.
Pat dry with paper towel.
Mix with remaining seasonings, starch, and oil until coated.
Spread in single layer on baking tray.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 40-50 minutes, flipping halfway.
Optional: broil 3-5 minutes for extra crispiness.

title: Sour Cream Dipping Sauce
ingredients: 1 teaspoon dried or fresh herbs (dill, basil, or scallions)
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in small bowl until smooth.
Chill in fridge before serving.

title: Pork & Shrimp Chive Dumplings
instructions: Mix ground pork with egg, salt, soy sauce, pepper, and green onion until sticky.
Add chopped shrimp, mix well.
Add oil and chopped chives, mix well.
Place filling in wrapper center, wet edges, fold and seal.
Boil large pot of salted water, add 20-25 dumplings.
When floating, add 1/3 cup cold water, boil again.
Add another 1/3 cup cold water, boil with lid open.
Test one dumpling, cook 1-2 more minutes if needed.
Serve with dipping sauce.

title: Vegetarian Dumplings (Chive, Egg, Tofu)
instructions: Beat and scramble eggs until firm, chop finely.
Add chopped tofu puffs and chives.
Mix with salt, pepper, and oil.
Wrap in dumpling wrappers and cook same as pork dumplings.

title: Japanese Curry
ingredients: 200-400g meat (chicken thigh, beef, pork, or ground)
instructions: Marinate meat with 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp cornstarch, pepper for 10 minutes.
Heat oil, sauté onion until translucent. Add mushrooms if using.
Add meat, stir-fry until color changes. Add soy sauce.
Add carrot and potato, stir for 2 minutes.
Add water to cover ingredients, boil, skim foam.
Simmer on low 15 minutes until 80% cooked.
Add curry roux blocks, stir until dissolved, simmer 5-10 minutes.
Add quick-cook vegetables in last 5 minutes.
Test doneness with fork. Adjust thickness with cornstarch slurry if needed.
Serve with rice.

title: "All Is Well" Minced Pork Rice Bowl
ingredients: 1 tablespoon oyster sauce (or honey or ketchup)
Optional: diced vegetables, green onions, Thai chili
instructions: Dice onion, mince garlic, mix cornstarch with water.
Heat oil, stir-fry ground pork until no longer pink.
Add onion and garlic, stir-fry 1 minute until fragrant.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, dark soy sauce, sugar, pepper. Stir well.
Add any diced vegetables, stir-fry 1-2 minutes.
Pour in water, bring to boil.
Optional: add raw egg to sauce, cover, simmer 2 minutes.
Add cornstarch slurry while stirring until sauce thickens.
Add fresh herbs/chili before turning off heat.
Serve over hot rice.

title: Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Scramble eggs, set aside.
Stir-fry rice, add vegetables.
Season with soy sauce + pepper, return eggs.

title: Easy Banana Bread
ingredients: 200g ripe bananas (2 medium, about 1 cup mashed)
80ml vegetable oil or melted butter (1/3 cup)
instructions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease or line a loaf pan with parchment paper.
Mash bananas with a fork, then add eggs, sugar, oil, milk, and vanilla extract; mix until combined.
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Sift into wet mixture and fold gently until no dry flour remains (do not overmix).
Pour batter into the pan and tap lightly to release air bubbles.
Bake for 45-55 minutes, until golden brown and a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool before slicing and serving.
Tips: Add chopped walnuts or chocolate chips for extra flavor. For muffins, bake 20-25 minutes instead. If no cake flour, substitute by replacing 20g all-purpose flour with 20g cornstarch.

title: Hot French Press Coffee
ingredients: 7/8 cup hot water (≈210ml, just boiled, wait 30 sec)
Optional: milk, soy milk, or coconut milk
instructions: Put coffee in French press.
Add 7/8 cup hot water.
Put the lid on (do not press yet), wait 4 minutes.
Slowly press down, pour.
Optional: add milk, soy milk, or coconut milk.

title: Cold Brew Coffee
ingredients: Optional: milk, soy milk, or coconut milk
instructions: Put coffee in jar or French press.
Add 1 cup cold water, stir.
Put the lid on (do not press yet), refrigerate 12 hours.
Press down or filter, pour over ice.
Optional: add milk, soy milk, or coconut milk.

title: Microwave White Rice (Sistema Cooker)
instructions: Add rice and water to microwave rice cooker.
Microwave on HIGH for 11–12 minutes.
Let rest 5 minutes with lid on.
Fluff and serve. Yields ~3 cups cooked rice.

title: Microwave Brown Rice (Sistema Cooker)
instructions: Add rice and water to microwave rice cooker.
Microwave on HIGH for 25–28 minutes.
Let rest 10 minutes with lid on.
Fluff and serve. Yields ~3 cups cooked rice.

title: Dorm Fried Rice with Egg
ingredients: Optional: 50g chicken breast cubes, 1-2 slices bacon, or 1-2 tbsp cooked bacon bits
instructions: Beat eggs in a bowl. Heat 2/3 tbsp oil in pan, scramble eggs into small pieces, set aside.
(If using chicken/bacon) cook until done, set aside.
Add rest of oil, stir-fry rice 2 min until loosened.
Add frozen vegetables, cover, steam 1-2 min until cooked and rice is hot.
Uncover, add soy sauce and pepper, stir-fry 1-2 min.
Return eggs (and meat/bacon) to pan, mix, fry 30 sec.
Sprinkle green onions before serving (optional).

title: Dorm Clear Soup Noodles
ingredients: 50-70g cooked chicken, beef, or sandwich ham
1 egg (fried, boiled, or soy sauce egg)
200ml hot chicken broth or boiled water
instructions: Boil kettle of hot water (for soup).
In pot, bring 800ml water to boil. Add noodles, stir to prevent sticking, cook 2-3 min until noodles float.
(Optional) Crack egg into pot for poached egg, or cook separately.
Place soy sauce and salt in serving bowl.
Blanch vegetables in noodle water 30-60 sec, add to bowl.
Place cooked chicken/ham and egg on top.
Pour in hot water or broth, mix gently.
Finish with white pepper, chili/cilantro, and sesame oil.

title: Dorm Stir-Fried Tomato and Egg
ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil (2 for eggs, 1 for tomatoes)
instructions: Beat eggs in bowl. Heat 2 tbsp oil in pan, pour in eggs, stir-fry quickly on high heat until just set but still soft. Remove and set aside.
Add 1 tbsp oil to pan, stir-fry tomatoes until they release juice.
Add salt and sugar (optional), stir well.
Pour cornstarch slurry around pan edge, cook 30 sec until sauce thickens.
Return eggs to pan, stir-fry 30 sec.
Drizzle sesame oil before serving. Sprinkle pepper or green onion if desired.

title: Dorm Baked Chicken Breast (Meal Prep or Dinner)
instructions: Let chicken rest at room temp 15 min.
Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Mix olive oil and seasonings.
Brush seasoning oil on both sides of chicken.
Bake 18-20 min, flipping halfway, until internal temp reaches 74°C (165°F).
Let rest before slicing.
Slice, portion into meal boxes, drizzle with pan juices.
notes: Refrigerate half: keeps 3-4 days (use for noodles, fried rice, salad, sandwiches).
Freeze half: keeps 2-3 weeks (thaw before use or cook directly in stir-fry).

title: Dorm Skillet-Roasted Lemon Chicken
ingredients: 1/2 cup dry white wine (optional, or use pan juices)
instructions: Preheat oven to 230°C (450°F).
Rinse and pat dry chicken. Cut open back and flatten.
Mix olive oil, herbs, fennel seeds, salt, pepper.
In oven-safe skillet, lay lemon, onion, garlic.
Place chicken skin-side down, brush with half oil mix; flip, brush rest.
Roast 30 min (check smaller chicken at 20 min).
Pour wine around pan (not on skin), roast 10-15 min until thickest breast reaches 68-71°C (155-160°F).
If no wine, spoon pan juices over skin instead.
After baking, squeeze lemon juice, cover with foil, rest 10 min.
Carve and serve with bread or baguette to dip juices.

title: Dorm Meatballs with Tomato Sauce
ingredients: 1 teaspoon olive oil or cooking oil
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook meatballs: If raw frozen, pan-fry with 1 tsp oil until browned.
Make sauce: Heat 1 tsp oil in pan, sauté garlic (optional). Add tomato sauce, meatballs, season, heat 5-10 min until boil, then simmer 3-5 min.
Serve: Spoon meatballs and sauce over rice, or mix with pasta. Top with cheese if desired.
